Posts.Content: im at chesterfield at the moment and the team here are lovely. ive seen 3 different nurses and 2 consultants but they all  workin together. the same bcn called me  after both of my ops and they all make it clear that I can call n e time. I will have to go to Sheffield for the rest of my treatment ( when I know what that is).not looking forward to the trek out every day . its a bit awkward to get to from here .
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: Hi all 14 days post 4th FEC. My energy levels are on the up again at last but I seem to get tired so easily. My hair has started to grow back but still more bald than not so shaved it again to avoid the scabby look . what was growing back was white so looks like im going to have to get used to a whole new look lol. 48 and im going to have more grey hair than my 68 year old mum. Got the whole mastectomy or another lumpectomy debate in my head at the moment. The onco has said a lumpectomy should be possible but I don't know whether its worth the risk. The first tumour didn't  act normally and onco admitted they didn't know what they were dealing with. They cant be sure that the second tumour wasn't acting up in the same way even though the tumours were different primaries. The second tumour also reared its ugly head only 3 weeks after surgery to get clear margins. My head is telling me that a mastectomy is probably my best option for peace of mind as well as anything else. I know this is a decision only I can make but I would appreciate some feedback. thanks Sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hi all. bloods done today, taken steroids earlier next lot at 8pm incase they change to docetaxel tomorrow. 4th chemo at 8.30am. Good luck to all you ladies having theirs tomorrow too. we have a bit of a bake off at our sessions. My turn this week. Date and walnut cake with a fudge sauce topping. Old family recipe. Nice way to break the ice and we can always say its the steroids making us eat it lol. Sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: talking of chemo brain lol apart from the forgetting what you were talking about watch out when you are baking. while making a toffee sauce to top a cake my brain told me it was cake mix and I tried scrapping the sauce off the spoon with my finger. take it from me hot sugar and skin don't mix. I wont be making that cake again for a while. im certainly glad I don't drive lol I would be an accident waiting to happen. I used to think baby brain was bad.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hi Dorothy I'm having fec number 5 on Thursday. I must say its very doable . Some side effects have got worse . It takes longer for me to recover. I'm tired longer ( well into second week ) I'm having to pace myself take my time. I'm having chemo through a canula so its getting harder to find a decent vein. I've never had nausea so cant say if that will get worse. a positive attitude is a great help. Its amazing what a difference it does make. sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hi all back from chemo 4. Oncologist really pleased with shrinkage so no change in chemo regime much to my delight. Iron count a bit low and blood sugars raised so now they are keeping an eye on that as I may be turning diabetic. Oh the joys. on the plus side cake went down a storm. Nurses took the rest to have later with a coffee lol. sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hi kazza. I'm still having my periods too. Due Thursday they have been getting lighter but a bit clotty. Hoped they would have stopped by now. 4 days post fec 4 and this one has hit like a tonne of bricks. No energy at all. Slept till 11.30 am today. Having to look at my diet too cos blood sugars were high and iron low. Oh the joys lol. Still 4 down 2 to go sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: well bloods done. FEC number 5 tomorrow. Hope it don't hit too hard got to go to skeggy on Sunday cos my daughter is singing on skeggy pier. hope everyone is having a good day sarah.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: yes thanks crissie. I'm coping at the moment but have a 24 hour number to call if I need to Sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: well I think the chemo has caught up with me. Feeling very nauseous today. Have actually vomited once, not good. My fairly easy ride couldn't last. Hope everyone else is having a good day. sarah
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Mags That's fantastic news. I officially became a NEDDY today. I have rads to go which should be in about 3 weeks. They've dropped that from 25 sessions to 15 so I'm one happy lady Sarah
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: hi hun. I had a lumpectomy in January and although I was in surgery for nearly 4 hours I went back to ward at 3.30 I was home by 5.30. seemed strange to me and all my family. they live in an area which keeps you in at least overnight. to be honest all you want to do when you get home is sleep sleep and sleep.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: hi. I have a 7 year old and a 10 year old. Their school has been amazing. They arranged for a nurse to go into school every couple of weeks to talk to them. I've finished chemo and had a mastectomy 12 days ago. Its all doable. Try to arrange for someone to take the kids in and pick them up at short notice during chemo cos you wont always have the strength to do it yourself. A support network is a must and keep the school up to date. My kids have been very supportive and understanding. They've been a true blessing   sarah
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Chemo is usually every 3 weeks and can take up to 5 hours each time because of weight checks, seeing onco etc. side effects can vary but for my first 3 sessions I had heart burn and lethargy which eased on about day 10 or so . most of my hair fell out around day 14 of first session so shaved it before second. I'm 5 weeks post chemo and its already growing back sarah
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: hi I had fec 6 sessions fec t is usually 3 of each. I didn't buy a wig at all. I stuck with scarfs at first then thought sod it and went au-natural and felt a great freedom in doing so. I cut my hair to a pixie cut when I was told i was having chemo and then shaved it when it started to fall out. sarah
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: if youve not found it already look for august chemo club or august post chemo club and ad to favourites. The ladies have either started chemo this month or well on their way and some like me finished chemo. They are a wealth of knowledge which is worth tapping in to sarah
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: know the feeling. it f######## kills. im a week on from surgery and still get pain. just don't forget the exercises they are worth the pain cos it means you can put on your own bra lol
Posts.Title: New here.

Posts.Content: im in for second op to clear margins tomorrow. not as anxious as first time. heres hoping all goes well.
Posts.Title: fingers crossed
